results.title: Faites Sauter la Banque = Rob the Bank
results.brief_description:
Garnier, a shopkeeper, gets taken advantage of by a local banker, Durand-Mareuil. Having lost everything on the stock exchange, he decides to get his money back by digging a tunnel under the bank all the way to the safes.

Credits: Producer, Raymond Danon ; director, Jean Girault ; writers, Jacques Girault, Jacques Vilfrid, Louis Sapin ; photography, Andre Germain ; music, Paul Mauriat.
Cast: Louis de Funes, Jean-Pierre Marielle, Anne Doat, Yvonne Clech, Claude Pieplu, Catherine Demongeot, Georges Wilson.

results.title: Fairytales and Fantasy Workshops: Carlton North Primary 18 July 2005: Groups A and B
results.brief_description:
Fairy Tales and Fantasy is an ACMI screen education program designed to encourage students to begin to develop an appreciation for the art and the craft behind moving image in its many forms, by developing their ability to think beyond the screen. Fairy Tales and Fantasy aims to develop students’ understanding of ways in which film-makers create screen texts. Students in Years 1-2 learn about:
- three key stages of plot development
- main elements of the fairy tale genre
- simple concepts related to camera use such as framing, shot types, angles
- the magic of blue-screen technology
- become actors in a short film during a blue-screen workshop that allows them to place themselves in a magical, fairy tale setting
- engage with a film program featuring traditional and non-traditional fairy tales, and participate in a related discussion
- learn some simple editing skills while they create a fairy tale story
- view their ACMI creations.
Fairy Tales and Fantasy and activities provided in the accompanying Teacher Kit are designed to assist students to develop a range of Screen Literacy outcomes. The program is also designed to assist students to develop understandings about the ways in which stories help us to make sense of the world and our place in that world. People all over the world tell stories in many different ways using oral, written and visual texts. This program and related activities enables students to share their experiences of story and to extend and refine their understandings by comparing a range of fairy tale and fantasy texts, analysing narrative structure and exploring animation and film adaptations of fairy tales.

results.title: Fame
results.creator_credit: Allan Parker, Alan Marshall, David De Silva and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: An energetic musical drama tracing the lives of eight talented teenagers who join Manhattan’s High School for the Performing Arts to train for show business careers. Follows their creative journey and emotional development from their painstaking audition day to their euphoric graduation performance four years later. The film is noted for its award winning soundtrack and the spontaneous dance sequence in the streets of New York during peak hour traffic. Cast includes: Irene Cara, Lee Curreri, Laura Dean, Antonia Franceschi, Boyd Gaines, Albert Hague, Tresa Hughes, Steve Inwood, Paul McCrane, Anne Meara, Joanna Merlin, Barry Miller, Jim Moody, Gene Anthony Ray and Maureen Teefy. Written by Christopher Gore. Original music by Michael Gore. (Awards: Academy Award 1980, Best Original Score)

results.title: Falling down
results.creator_credit: Joel Schumacher, Timothy Harris, Herschel Weingrod, Arnold Kopelson and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: On a hot, steaming day in Los Angeles Bill Foster (Michael Douglas) leaves his car in a traffic jam and walks through a violent, scarred city on his way home to find his estranged wife (Barbara Hershey). His attempt to go home finds him confronting an urban landscape devastated by random violence and extreme poverty. Foster, who has believed in the American Dream of wealth, patriotism and dignified labour, finds that only through violence is he able to have his voice heard. The subject of acute controversy when released, “Falling Down” does not slot easily into the vigilante genre. Our identification with Foster is constantly undermined by the accelerating pathology of his behaviour. This film eludes either liberal or conservative readings. What it reflects is a society not on the brink of chaos, but one in which disintegration is the norm. Robert Duvall is the cop on Foster’s trail and there is a frightening, intense cameo by Frederic Forrest as an all-American neo-Nazi.

results.title: Fallen
results.creator_credit: Gregory Hoblit, Dawn Steel, Charles Rover, Atlas Entertainment and Turner Pictures
results.brief_description: High budget supernatural thriller that sees Joe Hobbs (Denzel Washington) witness the execution of a serial killer. Things take a menacing turn when identical murders take place. It appears that a demon is passing through humans possessing them thus enabling the killer to continue with his murdering. Taunting the detective a twist at the end keeps the drama gripping. Police drama meets supernatural thriller. Cast includes John Goodman, Donald Sutherland and James Gandolfini.

results.title: Fall line
results.creator_credit: Greg Lowe, Bob Carmichael and Pyramid Films
results.brief_description: An exciting film of the high risk sport of extreme skiing. On a peak in Wyoming’s Grand Tetons a lone skier attempts the first climb and then the fall line - a breathtaking descent of the almost vertical slope. Awarded first prize, Sports, San Francisco International Film Festival. The skier is Steve Shea and the film has been narrated by Ron Hayes.

results.title: Faithless = Trolosa [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Ingmar Bergman, Liv Ullman, Kaj Larsen, YLE, Sf Norge As, Ab Svensk Film Industri and SVT Drama
results.brief_description: Liv Ullman, best known for her acting in iconic films by Ingmar Bergman, directs “Faithless”, from a script by Bergman. “Faithless” is the story of a bourgeois Swedish family whose lives are put asunder by an extra-marital affair. Marianne (Lena Andre) is happily married to composer Markus (Thomas Hanzon), living with their young daughter, Isabelle. David (Krister Henriksson), a friend to both Marianne and Markus, is a hapless writer and theatre director, onto his troubled second marriage, and a frequent visitor to the family home. David is depicted as a charming rogue with a self-destructive streak, filled with self-loathing. One night, when Markus is away on tour, David proposes to Marianne that they sleep together. Marianne refuses but her interest is piqued and the sanctity of her family unit is doomed. Told in extended flashback sequences, Marianne relays her story to the narrator, Bergman (Erland Josephson), who listens patiently, coercing Marianne to confess her indiscretions. This set-up, at a beautiful, remote beachside retreat, is reminiscent of many Ingmar Bergman films, in particular “Persona”. “Faithless” employs a leisurely pace to unfurl this tale of morality, betrayal, love and revenge, between three consenting adults and an innocent child. In Swedish with English subtitles.

results.title: Fair treatment
results.creator_credit: Tim Johnson, Chris McGill and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: This program examines some of the most important issues facing people living with HIV and contains interviews with people who are HIV positive. It focuses on the availability of drugs for HIV patients, and the lack of action and apathy shown by Australian governments. It also explores the outlook on life of the interviewees, how the stigma of AIDS, the death of friends and loved ones has affected them and finally examines their attitudes to death and dying.

results.title: Fair go!
results.creator_credit: Open Channel Productions, Tony Wright, Peter Moon and Penny Robbins
results.brief_description: “Fair go!” is a step towards meeting the needs of young people for information about their rights as workers. Using a fresh, entertaining presentation, the program follows the experiences of school-leavers Kelly and Sam, as they fall unawares into a series of near disasters in new jobs.

results.title: Faces of India: Raju, a guide from Rishikesh
results.creator_credit: Yavar Abbas and Face Film Productions
results.brief_description: Gives an intimate insight into the lives of the ordinary people in Rishikesh in the Himalayan foothills. The film follows a nine-year-old boy through a day’s work taking visitors around the town. We hear Raju giving facts and figures and details of everything he sees. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
